articles.title: FM of DPRK Sends Greetings to His Pakistani Counterpart
articles.content:
FM of DPRK Sends Greetings to His Pakistani Counterpart
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho of the DPRK sent a message of greeting to his Pakistani counterpart Khawaja Muhammad Asif on Nov. 9 on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
					 The message said that for the last 45 years since the establishment of diplomatic relations, the bilateral friendly and cooperative ties have expanded and developed in various fields in the common interests of the two peoples.
					
					 It is the firm stand of the DPRK government to value the friendly relations with Pakistan and steadily consolidate and develop the ties regardless of any changes of situation, the message said.
					
					 The message expressed the hope and conviction that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would further expand and develop, wishing him greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Will Have to Pay Dearly for Racket for Sanctions on DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Will Have to Pay Dearly for Racket for Sanctions on DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A spokesman of the Consultative Council for National Reconciliation gave an answer to a question raised by KCNA Thursday in connection with the fact that the south Korean authorities announced a "proposal for independent sanctions on the north".
					 The puppet authorities made public the "proposal", timed to coincide with U.S. President Trump's visit to south Korea, the spokesman said, and went on:
					
					 This is another unpardonable provocation to the DPRK and a hideous act of escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The "proposal" was announced one day before Trump's visit. This is a servile and clumsy act of brownnosing the master to flatter him.
					
					 The puppet regime itself admitted that the "independent sanctions" have neither effectiveness nor significance. But they are now trumpeting about "contribution" and "effect". This is a ridiculous and foolish act disclosing their poor position as colonial stooges who can prolong their remaining days only by currying favor with their master.
					
					 Their farce of slapping "sanctions on the north" is an act as foolish as trying to pump up water with net, and to expect any "sanctions effect" is as foolish as waiting for the sea water to dry.
					
					 No matter how desperately the U.S., all sorts of hostile forces and the puppet forces may try in their efforts to put pressure on the DPRK, nothing can check the army and people of the DPRK dynamically advancing toward the final victory with the might of single-minded unity under the uplifted banner of Juche.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces should clearly understand that the "independent sanctions" are as suicidal as tightening the noose already put around their neck.
					
					 They will be made to pay a dear price for having committed cursed crime before the nation to serve the gangster hanger-on who just spends a night in south Korea.

articles.title: Statement of DPRK NCC for Anti-Money Laundering and Combating Financing of Terrorism
articles.content:
Statement of DPRK NCC for Anti-Money Laundering and Combating Financing of Terrorism
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the National Coordinating Committee of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) for Anti-Money Laundering and Combating the Financing of Terrorism gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA on Thursday as regards the fact that an international financial supervisory body once again made a scene of adopting anti-DPRK statements:
					 A plenary meeting of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) on Anti-Money Laundering, an international financial supervisory body, was held in Buenos Aires, Argentina, from November 1 to 3.
					
					 Adopted at this meeting were an "open statement", that runs through with stereo-typed allegations such as the DPRK's failure to address the deficiencies in its anti-money laundering, and an additional "statement" calling for effective implementation of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) "resolutions" in order to stop the DPRK's financing of proliferation of Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMDs).
					
					 We strongly reject these statements as an unjust measure taken by the FAFT which has become extremely politicized due to the pressure from the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. tried to justify its financial sanctions against the DPRK by sticking the "accusation of money laundering" to our country, making an evil use of the international financial supervisory body, and now it is making a wicked move to block financial transactions of our country by establishing the UNSC "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK as "international standards" and coercing the member states into their implementation. 
					
					 The fact that the additional "statement" on "the threat posed by the DPRK's financing of proliferation of WMDs" adopted at the meeting copied relevant paragraphs word for word from the UNSC "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK is a clear testimony to that.
					
					 Behind the scene of adopting FATF statements lies the ulterior criminal motive of the U.S. to block all financial activities of our country, whether they are for civilian or military purpose, by calling them as a violation of the UNSC "sanctions resolution" against the DPRK in order to hinder the strengthening of our nuclear forces.
					
					 If the DPRK's possession of nuclear weapons, a righteous means for self-defense, should be branded as proliferation of WMDs and as a result its normal financial transactions with other countries be labeled as financing proliferation, it is palpably clear that the U.S., who has deployed tens, even hundreds of nuclear weapons in all parts of the world and even now is lavishing astronomical amount of funds on their maintenance and modernization, is indeed the chief culprit in financing proliferation of WMDs.
					
					 The DPRK, as a responsible nuclear weapons state, will continue in the future to actively join the international efforts for anti-money laundering and combating the financing of terrorism and proliferation of WMDs. However, we will never tolerate any attempt to deprive us of nuclear weapons.

articles.title: 5th Enlarged Plenary Meeting of 8th C.C., UAWK Held
articles.content:
5th Enlarged Plenary Meeting of 8th C.C., UAWK Held
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The 5th enlarged plenary meeting of the 8th Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) took place here on Thursday. 
					 The meeting discussed how to carry through the tasks set forth by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un at the Second Plenary Meeting of the Seventh Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Kim Chang Yop, chairman of the C.C., UAWK, made a report at the meeting which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers noted that the Supreme Leader at the Second Plenary Meeting indicated clear-cut ways and tasks to open up a turning phase of the revolution and construction through a bold and strenuous offensive and steadily advance the socialist cause of Juche.
					
					 They stressed that the union organizations at all levels should fully demonstrate their might as a reliable transmission belt and peripheral body in the drive to implement the decision made at the Seventh Congress of the WPK.
					
					 They expressed the will to build up all the organizations into powerful combat ones creditably discharging their revolutionary duty while sharing thought, breath and steps with the Party Central Committee by further enhancing their militant function and role.

articles.title: National Loach Cooking Contest Held in DPRK
articles.content:
National Loach Cooking Contest Held in DPRK
 Phyongsong, November 9 (KCNA) -- A national loach cooking contest took place in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province of the DPRK, on Nov. 8-9.
					 The contest, sponsored by the Central Committee of the Korean Association of Cooks, brought together cooks from 40-odd public catering service centers including the ones of ministries and national institutions and in Pyongyang and each province.
					
					 It was held in the way of estimating loach dishes, loach soup and fried loach cooked on the spot in a fixed time.
					
					 Okryu Restaurant and Chongryu Restaurant took special places and the Changgwang Public Service Management Bureau, Haebangsan Hotel, Kyonghung Guidance Bureau, Taedonggang District Restaurants Management Office and the South Phyongan Provincial Commercial Management Bureau the first place.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Wolfgang Nowak, former general director for Political Planning of Mr. Schroeder's Cabinet of Germany, and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun Thursday.
					 The visitors paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 Then they paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house the cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Korean Nation's Custom of Making Kimchi
articles.content:
Korean Nation's Custom of Making Kimchi
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Now is the kimchi-making season in the DPRK.
					 Kimchi is made of vegetables or edible herbs, seasonings, fishes, meat and fruit. Kimchi has a fresh taste and peculiar aroma and is high in nutritive and pharmacological value, thus gaining popularity in the world.
					
					 The custom of making kimchi and its development, different varieties of kimchi and their features and relics related to kimchi are on display at the Korean Folklore Museum to make the visitors promote an understanding of kimchi.
					
					 The Korean custom of making kimchi was registered as national intangible cultural heritage and world intangible cultural heritage.

articles.title: Phyohun Temple, Cultural Heritage of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Phyohun Temple, Cultural Heritage of Korean Nation
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- There are many precious cultural heritages in Mt Kumgang, one of the famous mountains of Korea.
					 Among them is Phyohun Temple, one of the four Buddhist temples in the mountain.
					
					 The temple, built in 670, is located at the entry to Manphok Ravine. At that time, it was called Sinrim Temple, but after three years, it was renamed Phyohun Temple.
					
					 The existing temple was rebuilt in the latter part of the feudal Joson Dynasty.
					
					 The Panyabo Hall, a central building with a hip-saddle roof and double eaves, shows well the outstanding architecture of Korean ancestors. It is 14.09 meters in front and 9.4 meters in the flank.
					
					 Phyohun Temple consists of several buildings with hip-saddle roofs and gabled roofs from south to north.
					
					 It is preserved well as the precious historical cultural heritage thanks to the culture conservation policy of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Trump's Hysterical Behavior Brings Fear to U.S.: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Trump's Hysterical Behavior Brings Fear to U.S.: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- These days political and social circles of the U.S. push ahead with the moves to restrain lunatic Trump's right to use of force as he may ignite a nuclear war any time, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a commentary.
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 It is the first time in the history of the U.S. that political and social circles of the U.S. called for restraining the right to use of force of the president who directly executes policy of aggression. Even former U.S. presidents express their opinions to restrict Trump's right to preemptive nuclear attack.
					
					 The facts prove that the bellicose remarks and war frenzy of Trump reached the extreme phase not to be allowed any longer.
					
					 Nobody knows when a nuclear war between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the U.S. may break out, because of Trump's reckless and frantic behavior.
					
					 Temerity of senseless Trump and his clan for a war may lead to a nuclear war against the DPRK on the Korean peninsula any time. No one can vouch that it would not lead to the worldwide thermonuclear war.
					
					 The U.S. is wholly responsible for this grave situation.
					
					 Unless the U.S. gives up its hostile policy toward the DPRK and nuclear threats and blackmail, the DPRK will counter it with nukes. It is the natural right of the DPRK for self-defence and this principled stand will never change.
					
					 Trump's hysterical behavior brings only fear and uneasiness to the U.S. society.
					
					 The U.S. and all other countries in the world can never be free from nightmare of nuclear war as long as Trump is allowed to go at large and the hostile policy toward the DPRK is continued.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Thursday carries a commentary condemning the U.S. for persisting in the futile anti-DPRK smear campaign over "human rights issue".
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Such campaign is arousing the towering indignation of the army and people of the DPRK as it is an unpardonable provocation aimed to hurt its daily rising international prestige and destroy its social system.
					
					 The U.S. has neither qualifications nor face to pull up others over the "human rights issue" as it is the worst human rights tundra.
					
					 It is the worst human rights abuser which makes no scruple of committing unethical crimes such as slaughter, arson and plunder in its own land and the rest of the world.
					
					 Yet, the U.S. is resorting to mean charade, talking about somebody's "human rights". This is an intolerable mockery and insult to the DPRK which provides the people with genuine rights and wellbeing on the highest level.
					
					 Such campaign is motivated by the U.S. heinous intention to exterminate a country and nation on the earth.
					
					 The U.S. is pinning its hope even on human scum in the smear campaign in order to recover its repeated setbacks in the showdown with the DPRK.
					
					 It is sadly mistaken for the U.S. to calculate it can achieve something from such sinister charade.
					
					 No matter how noisily the U.S. may trumpet about "human rights issue in the north", it sounds no more than dog's barking at moon.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will keep to the road of independence and justice chosen by themselves, no matter what others may say.

articles.title: U.S. President's Trip Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. President's Trip Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Actions against an old lunatic Trump's visit were reportedly staged in south Korea on Tuesday evening and Wednesday.
					 The No-Trump Joint Action consisting of over 220 political parties and social organizations had a rally called "people's candlelight for peace against war" in the Kwanghwamun plaza of Seoul on Tuesday evening.
					
					 The acting chairperson of the Confederation of Trade Unions said at the rally that the present "government" styling itself as candlelight "government" should put an end to the humiliating relations with the U.S., opposing Trump's speech at the "National Assembly".
					
					 On Wednesday, more than 2,000 members of the anti-Trump, anti-U.S. struggle headquarters and other organizations waged a fierce struggle against Trump's speech outside the "NA" building in Youido.
					
					 Meanwhile, on Tuesday evening, Trump and his party got a by-blow from the participants in the rally around the Kwanghwamun plaza when they went back to their lodging quarters.
					
					 The protestors threw bunches of leaflets critical of the war maniac and war merchant Trump and waste to the car carrying him.
					
					 On Wednesday, a ceremony for burning the U.S. flag took place in front of the "NA" building.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper on Anti-War Peace Demo in U.S.
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper on Anti-War Peace Demo in U.S.
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online newspaper Jaju Sibo Tuesday carried an article dealing with the escalating anti-war peace demonstrations against Trump's war policy in the U.S.
					 Noting that Koreans and progressive peace organizations in the U.S. staged demos opposing and protesting against old lunatic Trump on November 3 and 4, the article said:
					
					 When the north jolted the land with its ICBM-ready H-bomb test and launched ICBMs across the islands of Japan, residents in Guam and Hawaii fell into uneasiness after receiving evacuation notices. Now anti-war peace demos are gaining momentum even in the U.S. mainland.
					
					 In such situation, if the north launches ICBM, this will not fan up the climate for "punishing" but spark off Americans' demonstrations calling for the U.S. troops' withdrawal from south Korea and conclusion of the DPRK-U.S. peace pact.

articles.title: Anti-Trump Leaflets Scattered in Seoul
articles.content:
Anti-Trump Leaflets Scattered in Seoul
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The anti-Trump, anti-U.S. and anti-war special committee of the People's Democratic Party of south Korea on Nov. 7 scattered one million leaflets in different parts of Seoul on Tuesday to protest Trump's war visit to south Korea and the war games against the north, according to the south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo.
					 The organization stated that the leaflet scattering was aimed to awake the people in order to halt the war moves against the north escalated by Trump's war visit.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Moscow Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Russia on Nov. 4.
					 Mikhail Vikulin Mikhailovich, chief of the group, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize events in praise of the exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: DPRK Book Exhibition Held in Belarus
articles.content:
DPRK Book Exhibition Held in Belarus
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A DPRK book exhibition was held at the Vitebsk National Veterinary Academy in Belarus from Oct. 27 to Nov. 5 to mark the 72nd anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 On display there were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and various kinds of books showing the true picture of the DPRK.
					
					 The chief editor of magazine Social Education said at its opening ceremony that the exhibition would help the people of Belarus have a correct understanding of the DPRK, noting that he witnessed its realities through his recent visit.

articles.title: Brazilian Media Slam U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Brazilian Media Slam U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Media of Brazil carried articles denouncing the U.S hostile policy toward the DPRK under such titles as "Why did the DPRK develop nukes?" on Oct. 16-26.
					 Disclosing the fact that the Trump administration has persistently worked to inveigle many countries into its scenario to stifle the DPRK, the newspaper Hora do Povo said:
					
					 A good understanding of Korean-style socialism makes one clearly know how absurd is mud-slinging of the U.S. and its vassal forces against the DPRK with a history of 5 000 years and culture.
					
					 The world knows well that the DPRK developed nuclear weapons to cope with the U.S. constant nuclear threat and blackmail of decades.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrent serves as the only means to prevent a war and ensure peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is the legitimate right of all sovereign states to defend their countries and preserve their nations' sovereignty and territorial integrity.
					
					 The U.S. urges other countries to sever their relations with the DPRK. This is an insult to socialist Korea, disregard of the world people and a violation of sovereignty.
					
					 Its behavior is no more than a sinister attempt to deny each country's sovereignty, international laws and the UN Charter and put them into dustbin.
					
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of Songun Politics posted an article on its website stating that the reason why the DPRK started its nuclear program is the U.S. constant nuclear threat to it.

articles.title: Portavoz de CRN condena el acto absurdo de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Portavoz de CRN condena el acto absurdo de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de un reportero de ACNC formulada en relacion con el "proyecto de sancion independiente contra el Norte (de Corea)" publicado por parte de las autoridades surcoreanas, el portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional dio la siguiente respuesta:
					En visperas de la visita al Sur de Corea del mandatario estadounidense Trump, las autoridades surcoreanas publicaron el dia 6 el "proyecto de sancion individual sobre el Norte".
					
					Condenamos resueltamente esta absurdidad de las autoridades surcoreanas calificandolo de la nueva provocacion imperdonable contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la locura de confrontacion fratricida.
					
					Ese procedimiento de las autoridades surcoreanas deviene un acto vil para adular a su amo.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas hablan de un "aporte" y "efecto" de la "sancion individual", cuya ineficacia e insignificado fueron reconocidos por ellos mismos. Por tanto, la publicacion del reciente "proyecto de sancion independiente" deviene la conducta ridicula y estupida que revela la situacion miserable del titere colonial que debe lisonjear a su patron para mantener su vida. 
					
					Resultan absurdas la "sancion contra el Norte" y la esperanza en su "efecto".
					
					Por muy desesperadas las maniobras de EE.UU., las fuerzas hostiles y los titeres surcoreanos para dar presion a la RPDC, no podran detener con nada la marcha vigorosa de los militares y civiles coreanos que avanzan con el poderio de la unidad monolitica hacia la victoria final enarbolando la bandera del Juche.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos deben tener presente que sus locuras de "sancion independiente" sera un acto de suicida.
					
					Ellos pagaran precio carisimo por sus crimenes cometidos contra los connacionales adulando a su amo gangster norteamericano.

articles.title: Portavoz del comite coreano condena nuevas "declaraciones" anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Portavoz del comite coreano condena nuevas "declaraciones" anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ACNC) -- A la pregunta formulada por la ACNC con respecto a que tuvo lugar otra vez la farsa de adoptar las "declaraciones" anti-RPDC en un organo internacional de supervision financiera, el Comite Nacional de Coordinacion de la RPDC sobre el Anti-lavado de Dinero y Anti-Financiacion del Terrorismo dio hoy la siguiente respuesta:
					En la reunion plenaria de la Fuerza Atareada de Accion Financiera contra el Lavado de Dinero, transcurrida del dia primero al 3 en Buenos Aires de Argentina, se adopto una "declaracion abierta" que acusa a la RPDC de no arreglar todavia los defectos en la esfera de prevencion del lavado de dinero.
					
					Igualmente, quedo aprobada otra "declaracion" adicional que aboga por bloquear la financiacion de la RPDC a la proliferacion de armas de destruccion masiva mediante la implementacion consecuente de las "resoluciones de sancion" del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					Rechazamos categoricamente ese hecho calificandolo de un proceder injusto de ese aparato extremadamente politizado ante la presion de EE.UU.
					
					EE.UU., que trataba justificar, abusando del aparato, la sancion financiera anticoreana bajo la sospecha de "lavado de dinero", se porta vilmente para bloquear las transacciones financieras de la RPDC al definir las "resoluciones" del CS de la ONU como "pauta internacional" e imponerlas a los paises miembros.
					
					Lo comprueba el hecho de que la susodicha "declaracion" adicional titulada "Peligro de la financiacion de la RPDC a la proliferacion de armas de destruccion masiva" ha copiado los mismos articulos de las "resoluciones de sancion".
					
					La presente farsa deja conocer el cinico intento criminal de EE.UU. que para obstaculizar el incremento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC, trata de tildar todas las transacciones financieras, sean para fines civiles o militares, de "violacion" a las "resoluciones de sancion".
					
					Si la posesion de armas nucleares por parte de la RPDC con fines de autodefensa fuera calificada de proliferacion de armas de exterminio masivo y las transacciones financieras con otros paises fueran una forma de su financiacion, el culpable principal en este tema es precisamente EE.UU. que mantiene desplegados por doquier del mundo decenas y centenares de armas nucleares e invierte hoy dia tambien sumas astronomicas en su mantenimiento y modernizacion.
					
					Como portador responsable de armas nucleares, la RPDC se incorporara en lo adelante tambien a los esfuerzos internacionales por prevenir el lavado de dinero y la financiacion al terrorismo y a la proliferacion de armas de destruccion masiva, pero no tolerara nunca los intentos de quitarle el artefacto nuclear.

articles.title: Tiene lugar reunion ampliada del 5o pleno del octavo periodo del CC de UTAC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar reunion ampliada del 5o pleno del octavo periodo del CC de UTAC
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 9 en esta capital la reunion ampliada del 5o pleno del octavo periodo del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea con la participacion de los miembros y miembros suplentes del CC de la UTAC y los funcionarios de esta organizacion.
					En la reunion se discutieron las medidas para cumplir las tareas importantes presentadas por el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un en el 2o pleno del septimo periodo del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Hubo el informe de Kim Chang Yop, presidente del CC de la UTAC, y otros discursos.
					
					Los oradores dijeron que el Maximo Dirigente aclaro en el 2o pleno del septimo periodo del CC del PTC el rumbo y las tareas de lucha para abrir una coyuntura de viraje de la revolucion y la construccion mediante la ofensiva audaz y tesonera e impulsar la causa socialista del Juche.
					
					Exhortaron a las organizaciones a todos los niveles de la UTAC a manifestar plenamente el poderio de la confiable correa de transmision del partido y la organizacion auxiliar en los labores para lograr mayores victorias y saltos en la lucha por la materializacion de la resolucion del VII Congreso del PTC.
					
					Expusieron la decision de mejorar la funcion y el papel de las organizaciones de la UTAC para convertirlas en grupos combativos que cumplan bien con su mision revolucionaria compartiendo la idea, el aliento y el paso con el CC del PTC.

articles.title: Efectuada la reunion de conferenciantes activistas de UTAC
articles.content:
Efectuada la reunion de conferenciantes activistas de UTAC
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar ayer la reunion de conferenciantes activistas de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea con la participacion de los funcionarios de ramas interesadas y de la UTAC y los conferenciantes ejemplares del mismo gremio. 
					El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo del presidente del CC de la UTAC, Kim Chang Yop, y hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que en su obra "Para fortalecer aun mas la labor de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas", el Dirigente Kim Jong Il indico las tareas y remedios para elevar la responsabilidad y el papel de los conferenciantes.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un instruyo ajustar la educacion ideologica al nivel de preparacion de los trabajadores agricolas y a las condiciones concretas del campo e intensificar la agitacion y propaganda en todos los sectores enfrascados en el cumplimiento de la resolucion del VII Congreso del PTC, acotaron.
					
					Subrayaron que anteriormente, los conferenciantes hicieron aporte a preparar a los trabajadores agricolas como verdaderos revolucionarios del campo que defienden el Comite Central del PTC con la confianza absoluta en el Maximo Dirigente y la ferrea conviccion revolucionaria. 
					
					Reconocieron que ellos contribuyeron tambien a la produccion agricola al estimular a los campesinos a la lucha por materializar la tesis rural socialista y la orientacion del partido de producir gran viraje en el sector.
					
					Exhortaron a todos ellos a armarse con el gran kimilsungismo-kimjongilismo y guardar en el alma el espiritu del segundo pleno del septimo periodo del CC del PTC para seguir cumpliendo su honrosa mision y deber como propagandistas y educadores de la politica partidista en la produccion de cereales.
